intro: Evelyna oligantha, commonly known as the slender-leaved daisies, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, daisy-like flowers in shades of white and yellow. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Evelyna oligantha is often used in ornamental gardening for its delicate appearance and resilience.
